greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number m such that m^2+1 is divisible by A002144(n)^2 (= squares of primes congruent to 1 mod 4).
comment: a(2) = 70 since A002144(2)=13, 70^2+1 = 4091 = 13^2 * 29 and for no k<70 does 13^2 divide k^2+1. Related to period-1 continued fractions.
link: Klaus Brockhaus, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..2000
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Jan 26 2001
